items.content_html:
Request for Mozilla Position on focus-without-user-activation feature policy

  • Specification title: focus-without-user-activation feature policy
  • Specification or proposal URL (if available): whatwg/html#4585. The spec PR needs to be updated to reflect default value of self.
  • Explainer URL (if available): https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-permissions-policy/blob/main/policies/focus-without-user-activation.md
  • Proposal author(s) (@-mention GitHub accounts): @siliu1 @clelland
  • Caniuse.com URL (optional):
  • Bugzilla URL (optional):
  • Mozillians who can provide input (optional):
  • WebKit standards-position: WebKit/standards-positions#406

Other information

This issue is discussed during TPAC 2024 in webappsec and whatwg meeting.

The issue was resolved with proposed resolution:

RESOLVED: The default value of focus-without-user-activation feature policy should be self. Focus delegation should also be allowed (allow parent frame programmatically set focus into child iframe).
items.title: `focus-without-user-activation` feature policy

Following on #1044.

    • https://caniuse.com/?search=MediaStreamTrackProcessor
    • https://caniuse.com/?search=VideoTrackGenerator

    • https://bugzil.la/1749533

Other information

Transfer of MST (#1044) is already marked positive and is a prerequisite for these APIs, which in the spec are only exposed in DedicatedWorker.

items.content_html:
Request for Mozilla Position on an Emerging Web Specification

  • Specification title: Web Authentication's signal* family of methods
  • Specification or proposal URL (if available): https://w3c.github.io/webauthn/#sctn-signal-methods
  • Explainer URL (if available): https://github.com/w3c/webauthn/wiki/Explainer:-WebAuthn-Signal-API-explainer
  • Proposal author(s) (@-mention GitHub accounts): @nsatragno
  • Caniuse.com URL (optional):
  • Bugzilla URL (optional):
  • Mozillians who can provide input (optional): @jschanck
  • WebKit standards-position: WebKit/standards-positions#400

Other information

The WebAuthn signal methods allow relying parties to keep WebAuthn authenticator credential state in sync with their view of those credentials. Relying parties can signal that a user's name or display name have been updated, or that a credential is no longer accepted.
items.title: Web Authentication's signal* family of methods

items.content_html:
Request for Mozilla Position on an Emerging Web Specification

  • Specification title: WebRTC Extensions (section "RTCRtpEncodingParameters extensions", attribute "scaleResolutionDownTo")
  • Specification or proposal URL (if available): https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-extensions/#dom-rtcrtpencodingparameters-scaleresolutiondownto
  • Proposal author(s) (@-mention GitHub accounts): @henbos
  • Mozillians who can provide input (optional): @jan-ivar
  • WebKit standards-position: WebKit/standards-positions#396

Other information

This adds a new encoding parameter to WebRTC allowing the app to say which resolution it wants to send in absolute terms ("send 360p") instead of relative terms ("downscale by 2" + frame is 720p), avoiding race conditions when the track dynamically changes size.

Example use case is sending {360p, 720p} simulcast and when dynamically disabling the 720p layer also adjusting the track size to 360p in order to avoid expensive effects processing in 720p when only 360p is sent.

See https://www.w3.org/2024/08/27-webrtc-minutes.html#t06 where this was discussed and approved by the W3C WebRTC WG.
items.title: RTCRtpEncodingParameters.scaleResolutionDownTo

items.content_html:
Request for Mozilla Position on an Emerging Web Specification

  • Specification title: Private State Token API Permissions Policy Default Allowlist Wildcard
  • Specification or proposal URL (if available): WICG/trust-token-api#306
  • Explainer URL (if available): https://github.com/WICG/trust-token-api/blob/main/README.md
  • Proposal author(s) (@-mention GitHub accounts): @arichiv, @aykutbulut, @dvorak42, @krgovind
  • Issue URL (optional): https://chromestatus.com/feature/5205548434456576
  • WebKit standards-position: WebKit/standards-positions#391
  • TAG Review: w3ctag/design-reviews#990
  • Past Evaluation: #262

Other information

Access to the Private State Token API is gated by Permissions Policy features. We proposed to update the default allowlist for both private-state-token-issuance and private-state-token-redemption features from self to * (wildcard).
items.title: FYI Private State Token API Permissions Policy Default Allowlist Wildcard
